results.title: A Prison film: still living
results.brief_description: An open-ended film which examines life inside a women’s prison. The women in the institution are still very much alive and therefore still grappling with the same human concerns as the rest of us - except that incarceration serves to heighten those problems. Individual inmates and staff members of the prison express their attitudes, concerns, doubts and hopes.

results.title: A Pride of islands
results.brief_description: Visiting the island of the Hebrides showing how they fish, farm and weave to make a living. The only airport in the world to the covered by water twice a day. The old battlements, castles and monuments 3000 years old. Safe haven from the sea for sailors of all nations.

results.title: A Priceless day = Ajandek ez a nap [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Peter Gothar, Magyar Film, Hungarofilm and Budapest Filmstudio
results.brief_description: Adapted from a short story by Peter Zimre, “A Priceless day” is a quirky drama which centres around several characters whose lives are interwoven for various reasons, but not always the right reasons. Iren Zemann (Cecilia Esztergalyos) is a thirty something kindergarten teacher who is forced to move from her apartment when her elderly landlady dies. At the same time she is also mistress to Attila (Pal Hetenyi), a married man with children who has just told his wife Anna (Judit Pogany) about his affair with Iren. Attila, through his friend Hevesi, decides to find Iren a new apartment but all manner of complications ensue as Hevesi becomes involved in some rather underhanded dealings in securing Iren her new apartment, including a forced marriage in name only to Gabi (Janos Derzsi), a much younger single man, who would very much like to take advantage of his situation with Iren. An eventual meeting between Iren and Attila’s wife Anna provides a resulting ironic twist to the story. Set in 1970s Hungary, this is quite a poignant story reflecting the bleakness and the bureaucracy of the times. (Awards: Winner of the Golden Lion Award, Venice Film Festival, 1980)

results.title: A Practical guide to worm farming
results.brief_description: This video contains practical information on setting up a commercial worm farm, including: Pros and cons of different bed construction, worm biology/why worms, pests - including flatworms, common problems and how to overcome them, bedding, feeds, covers and harvesting.

results.title: A Practical guide to top fruit growing
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
Royal Horticultural Society expert Haden Williams gives practical advice on the growing of “top” fruits, ie. those produced on trees. Apples, pears, plums, peaches, nectarines and cherries are covered in the program. He advises the home gardener on the correct choice of aspect, soil preparation and drainage, feeding, pruning, grafting, and training of fruit trees into interesting forms such as fans and espaliers.

results.title: A Practical guide to soft fruit growing
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
The definition of soft fruits are those grown on canes and bushes as opposed to trees, eg strawberries, raspberries etc. This video gives a practical guide for beginners and established enthusiasts on how to grow and produce soft fruits in a small to medium garden. It provides a most comprehensive step-by-step guide with a brief history of each plant and great close-up photography. Each fruit is covered separately and includes strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, currants and gooseberries with advice and demonstrations given on propagation, cultivation, pests and diseases treatment and prevention, and pruning. A brief summary is given at the end of each segment with a final overall summary of the key points for success at the end of the program. Written and narrated by John Walmsley and presented by Haden Williams.

results.title: A Practical guide to propagation
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston, Celia Sullivan, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
Propagation is a way of allowing you to introduce a wide variety of plants into your garden whilst at the same time providing a cost-benefit and sense of achievement with the results. This excellent two-part program filmed at the Royal Horticultural Society’s garden at Wisley and presented by an expert team of RHS gardeners demonstrates the various techniques involved in propagating, beginning with seed sowing, and followed by division, layering, cuttings, budding and grafting, and chipping and scaling. Close-up photography and detailed step-by-step instructions covering a large cross-section of plants, choice of equipment, plus lots of useful tips and ideas make this video an ideal choice for gardeners at all levels. Presented by Anne Swithinbank.

results.title: A Practical guide to herbs
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston, Charles Mills, Charles Wace, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Royal Horticultural Society practical guides”.
Presented by Jekka McVicar, this detailed Royal Horticultural Society documentary offers a practical approach to the cultivation and use of herbs for both culinary and medicinal purposes. Beginning with a brief definition and history of herbs, the program goes on to provide detailed information on the creation of a herb garden, focusing on garden design, successful propagation using a variety of techniques, pruning, protecting, harvesting and drying. McVicar’s enthusiasm for her subject is apparent as she leads the viewer on a visual odyssey through the world of herbs, sharing tips and anecdotes along the way. Examples of exceptional herb gardens, such as Rosemary Verey’s Barnsley House and Raymond Blanc’s garden at Le Manoir aux Quat’Saisons are also shown, as are herb borders and other types of container, formal, and knot gardens.

results.title: A Practical guide to Europe
results.brief_description: A practical guide for people intending to travel to Europe. Provides advice on accommodation, public transport, food and cultural institutions in the major European cities. Hosted by John Guerrasio.
